panels.description: Number of healthy nodes in the cluster.
panels.title: Nodes

panels.description: Number of databases in the cluster.
panels.title: Databases

panels.description:
Number of opened shards in the cluster.

CouchDB only keeps opened shards that receive some activity: have received recent requests or are running a compaction job.
panels.title: Open shards

panels.description:
Number of opened file descriptors.

CouchDB normally opens: two per db, one per view index, one for compaction files, and a couple more for other tasks such as logging.
panels.title: Open OS files

panels.description:
Queries per second for special requests;
- Bulk requests involve a single POST request but may produce a significant amount of changes to a db.
- Temporary view reads are intended for development only (should aim to maintain at 0). They are forced to rebuild the view index in every request. Only in v1.X.X.
- View reads hit a defined view in the db.
panels.title: QPS by type

panels.description: Feed listeners receive all changes to a database in the form of a stream of responses. Feed listeners may request only once but involve a significant portion of the database IO or load.
panels.title: Continuous changes feeds listeners

panels.description: Data size represents the size of the data stored and Disk size the actual size on disk of the database. CouchDB runs periodic compaction jobs that will reduce the database disk size overhead.
panels.title: Size

panels.description: Data size represents the size of the data stored and Disk size the actual size on disk of the database. CouchDB runs periodic compaction jobs that will reduce the database disk size overhead.
